statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Kent State 111, Buffalo 107 (2OT)
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Kevin Warzynski had 23 points and Jay Youngblood added 22 to lead Kent State to a 111-107 double-overtime win over Buffalo on Wednesday night. Omni Smith also contributed 19 points for the Golden Flashes (18-7, 12-2 Mid-American Conference), who won for the fifth time in their last six games. Calvin Cage poured in a career-high 37 points and Roderick Middleton had 30 points for the Bulls (16-9, 6-8), who lost for the fifth time in six games. Cage notched the sixth-highest single-game point total in school history. Middleton's runner in the lane with 4.1 seconds remaining in regulation tied the score at 81 and sent the game into overtime. Kent State nearly won it at the buzzer, but DeAndre Haynes' desperation 3-pointer rimmed out. The Golden Flashes led 88-83 with 2:20 left in the first overtime, but Cage's three-point play with 11.5 seconds to go knotted the score at 93 and put the game into its second overtime. Kent State finally iced it with a 9-4 run in the first 3 minutes of the second overtime, capped by Haynes' 3-pointer. Before the game, the Bulls added Chad Upshaw to their roster. Upshaw, a junior, is the starting tight end on Buffalo's football team.
